Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with part of horizontal handle; interior glazed black with added red band at top; on top of rim, rays; exterior: on outer edge of rim, short vertical dashes with red core; inhandle zone large spoked rosette between black bands to left of handle; rosette with petals alternating in red and black; on bowl, black-figure decoration consisting of feline tail and part of wing or mane, to right; blob rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1117 and Cambridge Fitzwilliam GR.172.1894.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 330-1, no. B378)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0755) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 15)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
